author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Indonesia’s visa-free policy significantly increases foreign tourist arrivalsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Indonesia’s visa-free policy significantly increases foreign tourist arrivals
Indonesia’s visa-free policy has significantly boosted foreign tourist arrivals to the country from 30 out of the total 47 countries being offered the facility, observed Indonesia’s tourism ministry.
The number of tourist arrivals has increased by 16 percent since August, compared to only 2.9 percent during the January-July 2015 period.
I Gde Pitana, the deputy in charge of international tourism marketing development of the tourism ministry said, the most significant surge was observed from China, with an increase of 24 percent in August.
The government has extended the target from 10 million to 12 million foreign tourists for 2015 as the number of tourists to Indonesia exceeded all expectations in 2014.
The government is offering visa-free facility to the citizens of 47 countries from October 2015 as the policy was earlier only applicable to 45 countries. The new policy is intended to boost the number of foreign tourist arrivals, which is expected to reach 20 million by 2019.
The Indonesian government has planned to extend its visa-free facility to another 45 countries which will increase the number of recipients to 90 this year.
In a bid to improve its services, the government has increased the number of immigration checkpoints for entry from nine to 14 and 50 exit checkpoints for tourists coming from countries granted visa-free facility for travel to Indonesia. The 50 exit points comprise 19 airports, 29 seaports, and two land entrances.
